content:
Meeting in ~30 minutes!

Rough/tentative agenda for today:

  • Blog post topics (and person?)
  • Crater triage rotation
  • Charter
@T-release meeting!
alright, looks like not too many folks here today, but let's get started
First off I wanted to take a look at blog post topics -- release notes are up in a PR here - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/relnotes-1.54.0/RELEASES.md
In terms of topics, the ones that stand out to me are, macros in attributes, arch changes, and safe target feature for wasm.
I definitely agree on the first one -- I guess you mean wasm32 intrinsic stabilizations for the second?
It also uses const generics now.
I don't think that's particularly noteworthy for most users, but I agree some brief discussion of the breakage and some reasoning maybe could help...
but that sounds like a decent set
out of those here today, is anyone feeling up for at least creating a first draft of the post?
I don't think will have the time :(
The soonest I could take it on is the week after next.
I already have to run the release this cycle I think

Pietro Albini said:

I already have to run the release this cycle I think

"have to" might be a bit strong, but this is my recollection as well
OK
well, I mean, I think it's my turn :)
I think a week after next might be a bit later than I'd like
but it seems like a good fallback, at least
I think I should have time to get a first draft kicked off next week
OK
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
let's actually skip to charter, we'll circle back to crater triage if there's time

the charter group and I have been making some iterations, though moving quite slowly since I haven't been finding much time for it -- however, I'd like to get reviews/opinions/etc from others, and if people want to join the regular-ish (weekly, but we've skipped a bunch) meetings that could also likely be arranged
https://github.com/rust-lang/governance/blob/master/teams/release/charter.md is the current draft
I don't think we should discuss today - particularly with folks mostly not here - but I wanted to raise it, and maybe we'll follow up next week with some discussion?

Any thoughts?

@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
alright, moving onto crater triage
after discussion in the #t-release > crater triage rotations it sounds like the best way to get more volunteers for it is to get a rotation going
Do folks have thoughts on to how best structure that?
I was thinking we'd assemble a list and then go in order
yeah
the only commitment I can personally make to release is being part of the do-the-release rotation, but the plan sounds good
(even 3 people would give us something like 3 times a year, would be already significant improvement)
ok
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
alright, let's call it here then. Thanks!
